briefTitle: The Efficacy and Safety of Initial Triple Versus Initial Dual Oral Combination Therapy in Patients With Newly Diagnosed Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension
officialTitle: The Efficacy and Safety of Initial Triple Versus Initial Dual Oral Combination Therapy in Patients With Newly Diagnosed Pulmonary Arterial Hypertension: A Multi-center, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Phase 3b Study
summary: The objective of this clinical trial is to compare the efficacy and safety of an initial triple oral treatment regimen (macitentan, tadalafil, selexipag) versus an initial dual oral treatment regimen (macitentan, tadalafil, placebo) in newly diagnosed, treatment-na√Øve patients with pulmonary arterial hypertension.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline to Week 26 in Pulmonary Vascular Resistance (PVR)

effectByArm.arm: Triple Oral Therapy (Macitentan, Tadalafil, and Selexipag)
Double Oral Therapy (Macitentan, Tadalafil, and Placebo)
